subNodes.conversationText: root

Ilmater bless you. I am Brother Anselm, the village priest. [To Vroman.] I mark the resemblance between you and this poor man, traveler. Are you his brother?|***ga_move-->String::intro2_wp3 Int::0 String::vroman |
Yes.  As you can see, I inherited all the luck.  Will he get a decent burial?  I will do all I can for him, though I suppose a good grave is all he can expect at this point.
He will see a decent burial, but the fate of his body is less important than that of his soul.  Remember that he walks now among the mansions of the gods.
[Gazing once more at the body.] You have your beliefs, priest, but your words are wasted on me right now.
Vroman, I understand that you are suffering, but this priest deserves a little more respect.|***ga_global_int-->String::moral    String::++    |
Perhaps you're right, <FirstName>.  I am shaken, and ought not to take it out on the cleric.  I apologize, Anselm.
Think nothing of it.  As for the burial, Hamfast has declared that, given the unfortunate circumstances, the town will pay for it.
Very well.
[To Vroman.] Do you wish to spend any more time with the body, sir?
No.  It would do neither Manfred nor me any good.
Dunne and Obern, my acolytes, will take the body away, and I will supervise the burial.  If you seek further spiritual guidance, you can find me in the chapel.

|***anselm_pause-->***ga_fade_to_black-->Float::4    Float::10    Int::0    ***ga_destroy-->String::herbert    Int::0    Float::3    ***ga_destroy-->String::donne    Int::0    Float::3.2    ***ga_destroy-->String::manfred_corpse    Int::0    Float::3.4    ***ga_destroy-->String::manfred_blood    Int::0    Float::3.4    |

Damn, . Damn, damn, damn. What am I to do now? What are we to do now? Should we just go? Manfred was my only family left, you know; now I am truly on my own, except for you. Perhaps we should just leave this place for good.
Do not rush yourself.  You have just lost a brother.
We should not think of leaving until we have spoken to the paladin.  I know this is difficult for you, but you can't walk away from here as if it did not happen.
I suppose...I suppose that I do not truly want to go.  But I do not want to keep you here against your will, either.

It would be quite heartless of me to want to leave at a time like this.  Come.  We will find the paladin together.|***ga_destroy-->String::brother_anselm    Int::0    Float::0    ***ga_global_int-->String::sympathetic    String::++    |
There may be an opportunity for adventure in this.  Off we go.|***ga_global_int-->String::abrasive    String::++    ***ga_destroy-->String::brother_anselm    Int::0    Float::0    |
[Nod.] Let's find the paladin.|***ga_destroy-->String::brother_anselm Int::0 Float::0 |
By <Deity>, Vroman, neither of us leaves this place until we have the details of your brother's death. |***ga_global_int-->String::moral    String::++    |
[Shrug.] I am glad that you aren't my brother.|***ga_global_int-->String::ironic String::++ |
A cruel jest, but I suppose I deserve it.  Does this mean you want to stay here?
Yes.
We might as well.
That is very generous of Drawn Swords.  Our great thanks.|***ga_global_int-->String::courteous    String::++    |
We are a small and isolated community, but Ilmater has instructed us well in the importance of compassion.  You are truly welcome.
You mentioned a man named Hamfast.  Who is he?
But of course.
Hamfast?  The paladin mentioned him too.  Who is he?
Hamfast Bairnson is the town smith, and also acts as its leader.  You can find him in Swordskeep.
Swordskeep?
Yes, the old keep right behind me.   In it are the smithy and the chapel, where the folk of Drawn Swords gather to worship Ilmater.

As a <man/woman> of faith myself, Vroman, I think you ought to be a little more courteous with Brother Anselm. ||***ga_give_xp-->Int::100    Int::0    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::2    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::6    ***gc_check_class-->NOT::False    Int::12    ||
Perhaps you're right, <FirstName>.  I am shaken, and ought not to take it out on the cleric.  I apologize, Anselm.
[Say nothing.]
Ilmater smiles on you nonetheless, traveler.  As for your question, Hamfast has declared that, given the unfortunate circumstances, the town will pay for your brother's burial.
